title: Easy Plum Cake
description: This plum cake is super easy to make and perfect for using fresh juicy plums in late summer and early fall for a fabulous fruity dessert.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Cakes Sponge Cake Recipes Easy Plum Cake 4.7 (11) 10 Reviews 6 Photos This pretty plum cake is made with a buttery sponge cake recipe, topped with sliced plums, cinnamon, and sugar before being baked to perfection for a delicious way of using fresh plums when in season. Serve with whipped cream. By Allrecipes Member Updated on July 26, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 45 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 8 Yield: 1 (10-inch) cake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings ¾ cup white sugar ½ cup unsalted butter, at room temperature 2 large eggs 1 cup all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon baking powder 1 pinch salt 12 medium ripe plums, halved and pitted 1 ½ tablespoons cinnamon sugar, or to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10-inch springform pan. Combine sugar and butter in a large bowl and beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, and beat well after each addition. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl and sift on top of the butter mixture; mix to combine. Transfer batter into the prepared springform pan and smooth out. Set plums inside batter, cut-side up, and sprinkle evenly with cinnamon-sugar. Bake in the preheated oven on the lowest rack until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes. Serve warm or cool to room temperature. I Made It Print 22 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Plum Cake 01 of 06 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 06 Photo by  Jules 04/29/2024 Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser Great flavors Family favorite Everyone that had a slice loved this tasty dessert. It was moist , sweet and tangy . The plums were a perfect contrast and balanced out the sweetness . Received lots of compliments and I loved how simple it was to make . I recommend making double the recipe . I read the previous feedback and based on this I doubled my quantity and it was perfect. 03 of 06 Photo by  OrangeTea3806 09/17/2023 We made it gluten free by using g.f self raising flour and low fat olive spread! Worked out beautifully! 04 of 06 Photo by  AllrecipesPhoto 02/27/2021 05 of 06 Photo by  AllrecipesPhoto 02/27/2021 1 You’ll Also Love Italian Olive Oil Cake 16 Ratings Polish Cherry Cake 36 Ratings Polish Coffee Cake 3 Ratings Blueberry Ricotta Squares 117 Ratings Irish Apple Cake Irish Apple Cake Italian Lemon Coffee Cake 14 Ratings White Peachy Sangria 71 Ratings Christmas Plum Pudding 7 Ratings Peach Burrata Salad 6 Ratings Pangiallo laziale (Italian Christmas Cakes) Sparkling Peach Sangria German Apple Cake 1,555 Ratings White Peach Sangria 506 Ratings Figgy Pudding 35 Ratings Grilled Fruit Kabobs 15 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Allrecipes Member
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10-inch springform pan.;Combine sugar and butter in a large bowl and beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, and beat well after each addition.;Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl and sift on top of the butter mixture; mix to combine.;Transfer batter into the prepared springform pan and smooth out.;Set plums inside batter, cut-side up, and sprinkle evenly with cinnamon-sugar.;Bake in the preheated oven on the lowest rack until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes. Serve warm or cool to room temperature.
